title: Lordsilvabtc
author: Lordsilvabtc
content: Greetings to the entire family of Bitcoin talk community, It's a great privilege and honour to be here. During my time of research, I found out that a lot of project, both past and present are scamming people one way or the other, they rip those investors off their hard earned money. This got me thinking what are the categories, features and observation to put into consideration before investing in a crypto project. I really want to learn and enlighten my self about this.

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: There is no 'consideration', 'observation' or 'categories' to exactly indicate to you the outcome of a project. If you have researched like you say and found out that many projects have scammed investors, why are you still considering investing in them with your hard earned money, those scammed investors you read about where initially like you, they read about others being scammed, but they still went on with it, you probably may be amongst the next group of scammed investors that people will research about in the future.If you are investing in new altcoin projects, take it like you are gambling with your money, 'expectation kills', so consider every dime invested as being lost and don't expect anything, unless the opposite then happens, OR just purchase bitcoin that's securely decentralized and start using dca to increase your portfolio for the long term, if you have your funds in your noncustodial wallet and safely in cold or offline storage without making mistakes nobody can rip you off your BTC.

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: Quote from: Lordsilvabtc on October 10, 2022, 04:43:11 PMThanks a lot for this response, But in all honestly, I do strongly believe that some new Altcoin are still potential, and not all might end up being scam. Just my takeThere may be some like that, but how do you find them, it is like a task of searching for a needle in a haystack or trying to recover bitcoin you lost all backups to, in both cases your search will end up with no good results. The call is yours in the end, all the bitcointalk community can do is give you our individual opinion. Do not forget that initial hype, which is what most new projects have, isn't potential in itself, a coin with potential will last for a long time and most new altcoins do not. Some altcoins may not be scam in terms of rug pulling and running away with people's money, but when one creates a useless coin like do kwon did with luna and the entire system collapses, causing investors to lose billions of dollars, that is surely a scam too.

comments.body: The best is don't invest in new projects. If you love it, wait a half of a year before you think of joining. comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: Lordsilvabtc on October 10, 2022, 04:43:11 PM...I do strongly believe that some new Altcoin are still potential, and not all might end up being scam. Just my takeThen don't ask someone to dissuade you from what you consider to be a good business opportunity, because the responsibility of any investment should be solely yours. Most people who are not inclined to altcoins will advise you to invest only in Bitcoin, but if you go to altcoins boards, you will certainly hear the opposite opinion.In order to investigate the risk that comes with such projects, you need to have a lot of experience, because although there are those who literally scream "scam" everywhere, there are also those who are very mean and invest a lot of money and time to create the impression of legality.

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: I'd suggest you to stick with Bitcoin only since it's remain the safest coin to invest, as long as you can maintain your security and privacy, I'm sure your coins still on your wallet even though you leave it for next 10 or 20 years.But you shouldn't blindly invest on Bitcoin, you should understand what is Bitcoin first, so you can know what's the reason why you're invest on Bitcoin regardless how much the price is.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: Quote from: Lordsilvabtc on October 10, 2022, 04:16:39 PMfeatures and observation to put into consideration before investing in a crypto project.You should never "invest" in altcoins because in order to invest in something it has to have long term potential which can only happen if they offer real utilities. Since altcoins don't have any real utilities, they don't have any long term potential.This is why the "trading" market is very active and prices are too volatile in a scheme called pump and dump. Basically people make bets on altcoins in short term during their pumps and make a quick profit by dumping them before others.Meanwhile those who baghold altcoins miss all that action while watching their "investment" melt away.This is true about all the altcoins too. For example ETH used to be worth twice as much as its current price in 2017 and any bitcoins you'd invested in it is now cut in half since it got dumped and could never recover. But in short term it has good pumps and you could have ridden to increase the amount of bitcoins you own which actually has a lot of utilities hence long term potential.

comments.author: CryptopreneurBrainboss
comments.body: Quote from: Lordsilvabtc on October 10, 2022, 04:16:39 PMDuring my time of research, I found out that a lot of project, both past and present are scamming people one way or the other, they rip those investors off their hard earned money. This got me thinking what are the categories, features and observation to put into consideration before investing in a crypto project. I really want to learn and enlighten my self about this.Actually most project never had the intention of developing themselves into becoming a proper company in the spacesl even with all the money they have raised and it's always a shame seeing this. I have worked with some numbers of project and majority are just after the hype, the moment the hype dies down the project dies as well. Altcoins are just selling beliefs and never a product. They claim they can solved a particular problem then investor get excited and handÂ  over their money then the project vanish as they never had any intention of solving that problem in the first place while others go around claiming to solve a problem which doesn't even exist or already have a working project solving that same problem. Altcoins lack utility and they're just useful for trading purpose (which you should be very educated before you engage in such) and immediately that's lost they die. There's no blueprint for investing in an altcoin and get it right. Those doing so and profiting most times are just lucky or following the trend which if you're not smart enough would end up getting you rekted.

This two factor would be my priority then I would check out other factors.
